title: Attack Flow
description: This schema describes the Attack Flow JSON format.

type.description: Indicate that this is an Attack Flow.

id.description: The identifier for this Attack Flow. MUST be unique within this document. TODO: Ideally is unique among Attack Flows produced by a particular organization.

name.description: The name of the Attack Flow.

created.description: Creation time of the Attack Flow.

author.description: The author of the Attack Flow.

description.description: The description of the Attack Flow.

actions.description: The list of action nodes in the attack flow

id.description: The identifier for this Action. MUST be unique within this document.

type.description: Indicate that this is an Action

name.description: The name of the action. May be an ATT&CK technique name.

timestamp.description: The timestamp when this action was observed.

reference.description: A reference for the action. May be a URL to an ATT&CK technique.

succeeded.description: Float from 0 (failed) to 1 (succeeded) or distribution representing the probability that action succeeded in its effects. Any effects which may be separable should be defined through a separate action. Assumed to be 1 (100% ~ TRUE) if not included.

confidence.description: Float from 0 to 1 or distribution representing the confidence that the action succeeded. Assumed to be 1 (100% ~ ground truth) if not included.

logic_operator_language.description: The language of the logic_operator. Defaults to flow-vTBD when left blank.

logic_operator.description: The logic_operator may be any logic valid in the language defined by the logic_operator_language. If the logic_operator_language is undefined, the logic_operator may be AND or OR, representing the relative operation on all required-by relationships. The logic_operator must return the state changes to the provides relationships.

assets.description: The list of asset nodes in the attack flow

id.description: The identifier for this Asset. MUST be unique within this document.

type.description: Indicate that this is an Asset

state.description: A property that may be used as a transient string representing the state of the object during a point in time representing the current state of the system. The sum of all object states is the state of the system. This may be as simple as "compromised", the Confidentiality, Integrity, Availability triad, DIMFUI (Degradation, Interruption, Modification, Fabrication, Unauthorized Use, and Interception), or it may even be an arbitrary string. If not included, it is assumed that the state is 'compromised' after a parent action succeeds.

relationships.description: The list of relationship edges in the attack flow. All Actions MUST have a relationship to the flow.

source.description: The source flow, action, or asset for this relationship.

type.description: Indicate that this is a Relationship

target.description: The target asset, action, or property. If the target is an Action, the source MUST be an Asset. If the target is an Asset, the source MUST be an Action.

type.description: Indicate that this is a Property

source.description: The source action or asset for this property.
